msContents.summary: Letter of Onnophris to Zenon reporting the results of his assessment of land allotments held by veterans in the two 10,000 aroura estates of Andromachos and Panouphis: in the first estate the proportion of land rendered uncultivable by rising salt is mentioned. Then follows a list of holdings of various cleruchs

msItem.note: The letter was folded 9 times and the fissures between fragments run along 2 of the folds
The hand appears fluent but irregular; there are some spelling mistakes caused by unfamiliarity with Greek
Many ink traces on both sides: the letter was folded when the ink was not dry

The front (there is a joint between 2 sheets in the middle of the second col.) is written along the fibers with 16 lines in the 1st fr. and 10 in the 2nd; the text continues in the back of the 1st fr., across the fibers; on the back there are also various figures, the address and the docket

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in December 1926; nos. 4 and 69 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Names of many cleruchs, -- see Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, sec. IX
